instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02382: What is 820-02382? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V8_AWAKE: What is PP1V8_AWAKE? The PP1V8_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is indicative of a power rail that delivers 1.8 volts when the machine is in an "awake" state. This is not a traditional power state defined in the older Intel PCH documentation; it seems to be specific to newer MacBook architectures. The "awake" designation likely refers to a state where the MacBook is on and ready for user interaction, but it is not necessarily at full operational capacity (which would be denoted by an S0 state).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  5v only.
threads.message:
12v rail is present,
PMU is operational and sends out <SIGNAL>PMU_SYS_ALIVE</SIGNAL> to UN400
UN400 does not send out P2v5 NAND0 EN

I did not find any shorts.   All the CPU rails are up.
PMU is working
NAND rails have no shorts.  The power is just not being turned on.

Did not observe data on 12c_SCL or SDA lines.

Looking for any input from the community on this board.   My experience is limited on this board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  5v only.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  5v only.
threads.message: I did find some corrosion VPUMP_SPMU cap that goes to <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>.  That 5v is still present. They are going to try DFU later today.   I will update this thread.   What is VPMUP-SPMU anyway?  This is apple silicone so I cant find information on it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02382</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  5v only.
threads.message:
DFU didn't help.   but I did find corrosion on: PPV4V9_VPMUP_SPMU on <CAPACITOR>C7752</CAPACITOR>.
cleaned it up and replaced the cap.  The 5v is present.   This 4v9 rail hit <SIGNAL>PP1V8_AWAKE</SIGNAL> through <CAPACITOR>C7790</CAPACITOR> next to it.  That runs to <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> so I am sure that chip is gone.  It also runs to ROMs and a bunch of other stuff.    The only donor I have for this board I fixed so I don't want to start harvesting.   There could be 7 other chips plus <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> affected.     I am just going to shelf this board for a rainy day when I have donors for it.

The liquid so so hard to find I missed it the first time around.  This board taught me allot about how these new boards function.  It was well worth the experience.

I hope this information helps someone.

Cheers.
